title: Is string theory probably wrong? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hmm… As I’ve read about the string theory till now, it might seem true. String theory predicts that all the subatomic particles in the universe are made up of vibrating strings. You can try it yourself by pulling a string at different rates. You can watch this video where michio kaku explains it better than me.. :  So after all these research and everything, what I could conclude is that it may be true. BUT… it might be proved wrong by some other theory in future, who knows??!! It is like we believe in the atomic structure even though we have no idea of how it might look!!!!! Nice question though : )

The saying is that string theory is “not even wrong”. The issue is not whether it is right or wrong but rather whether it can make falsifiable experimental predictions. For example, predict a new particle and what it’s characteristic is. Until now it hasn’t done that and one issue is that there are too many parameters open for “tuning” the results of a measurement therefore the theory can’t make predictions at this stage. Proponents are convinced it is right and ask for patience to let it prove itself.
